meanings.definition: To earn more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outearned her brother by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: The hardworking employee outearned all her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outearned the rabbit in collecting nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outearned any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The student outearned top marks in the class with consistent effort.

meanings.definition: To have a higher income than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Despite starting late, he outearned his peers with smart investments.
meanings.sent2: The successful entrepreneur outearned all his competitors in the market.
meanings.sent3: The cat outearned the dog in treats by being extra charming.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for her work outearned any monetary rewards.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outearned endorsements due to their exceptional performance.
